bioghist.p: The American Church in Paris was founded by the American and Foreign Christian Union in 1857. The initial membership consisted of a small group of Americans who had been meeting in a French Reformed Church since 1814. Today over 500 persons representing a wide variety of Christian backgrounds and traditions regularly worship each Sunday.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes minutes of the Ladies Benevolent Association of the American Church in Paris, 1889-1954; an account book of the Missionary Society of the American Church, 1904-1916; minutes of the Missionary Society of the American Church, 1872-1879 and 1894-1900; minutes of the Social Committee of the American Church in Paris, 1894-1902; minutes of the Sunday School Association of the American Church in Paris, 1923-1933; an 1839 published volume of Offices of the Church of England; glass plate negatives of the Church's altar and its exterior; American and Foreign Christian Union materials from the annual meetings in 1981 and 1990; and a guest book of the American Student Atelier Reunion, 1963-1967 (including reunion programs). Also included are materials from the Annual Congregational Meeting, January 21, 1996; minutes of the American Church of Paris Council, 1996; copies of The Spire on the Seine newsletter, 1996; and copies of the Paris Connections newsletter, 2000-2002.
